greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum T(n,k) over all partitions lambda of n into k distinct parts of Product_{i:lambda} prime(i); triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=A003056(n), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..500, flattened
example: T(6,2) = 43 because the partitions of 6 into 2 distinct parts are {[5,1], [4,2]} and prime(5)*prime(1) + prime(4)*prime(2) = 11*2 + 7*3 = 22 + 21 = 43.
maple: g:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0, expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(g(n$2)):
mathematica: g[n_, i_] := g[n, i] = If[n==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Expand[Sum[g[n-i*j, i-1] * (Prime[i]*x)^j, {j, 0, Min[1, n/i]}]]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[ Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][g[n, n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 20}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 26 2015
